required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevention and Treatment With Hydroxychloroquine + Azithromycin of Acute Respiratory Syndrome Induced by COVID-19
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Trial for the Prevention and Treatment With Hydroxychloroquine + Azithromycin of Acute Respiratory Syndrome Induced by COVID-19

lead_sponsor.agency: Maimónides Biomedical Research Institute of Córdoba

clinical_study.source: Maimónides Biomedical Research Institute of Córdoba

brief_summary.textblock: Multi-centered, randomized, open label clinical trial to study the safety and effectivity of hydroxychloroquine + azithromycin to treat COVID-19 symptoms in primary care patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
In the patient group treated with hydroxychloroquine + azithromycin we expect to find a diminution of 20% or more regarding the evolution of acute respiratory syndrome, as opposed to patients who have not been treated with these medicines.
To date, there is no shown effective treatment regime for acute respiratory distress caused by COVID-19.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until patient's hospitalization happens, assessed up to 28 days.
From date of randomization until ICU admission as a result of COVID19, assessed up to 28 days.
From randomization until death by any cause related to COVID19, assessed up to 28 days.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From randomization until healing, hospitalization or death. Symptoms will be evaluated every 24 hours for a minimum of 10 days and a maximum 28 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical evolution will be evaluated through the following symptoms: fever, cough, dyspnoea, diarrhea, loss of smell.

arm_group.description: Hydroxychloroquine. 1st day 200mg 2-0-2; 2nd to 5th day 200mg 1-0-1 Azithromycin. 1st day 500m 0-1-0, 2nd to 5th day 250mg 0-1-0 Oral intake in all cases. Pills will be taken simultaneously.
SOC for symptoms treatment Acetaminophen or Metamizole, 1-1-1 Antitussives if needed

intervention.description: Hydroxychloroquine. 1st day 200mg 2-0-2; 2nd to 5th day 200mg 1-0-1 Azithromycin. 1st day 500m 0-1-0, 2nd to 5th day 250mg 0-1-0
Acetaminophen or Metamizole. Antitussives if needed.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with positive semi-quantitative PCR and COVID19 symptoms (fever, cough, diarrhea, dyspnoea, loss of smell).
- Signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Retinal degeneration.
- Congenital or acquired long QT syndrome.
- Advanced liver failure.
- Renal insufficiency (incompatible with creatinine clearance less than 50 mL /minute).
- Allergic to hydroxychloroquine or azithromycin.
- Serious interaction with the drugs used.
- Pregnant or breastfeeding.
- Men and women in fertile and sexually active periods, who do not accept a highly effective contraceptive method.
- Inability to follow study procedures.

facility.name: Centro de Salud Priego de Córdoba

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be shared after the study concludes and results are published
